div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Our hearts nearly burst with joy seeing you and your children during our Teacher Parade on Friday. Thank you so much for your expressions of love and support which brought all of us to tears. The love and connectedness of Dummerston School community is certainly not bound by a physical building but rather rests within each individual who makes up our school community. Thank you to Molly Stoner for creating our parade route and to Deputy Jessica Fellows of the Windham County Sheriff's Office and Rich Cogliano of the Dummerston Fire Department for helping us travel the roads safely.

I want to wish you well this vacation week. Should you have an urgent need, please contact me, our school nurse Mary Ann Runge, or our school counselor Erica Garnett at our usual e-mails or by calling (802) 451-0744. Meals will continue to be delivered this week as usual. Please visit wsesu.org or call Ali West at 802-257-3322 if you need further information or have questions.
Crisis Text Line: Text VT to 741741

On the right, please find a video message of support for your children from a number of Dummerston School staff. This vacation week, your children may appreciate viewing a few minutes of this compilation each day.
I hope you have an opportunity to spend time with loved ones this week and enjoy the bursting forth of the spring season.
